Posts.Content: Jun 16, 2010 08:13PM jeanl151 wrote: hi girls,  all this hair growth is great.  Here is my new avatar with hair (short but mine).  I am 16 weeks PFC.  It came in very grey and I decided it had to go.  I used one of the root touch up kits from the store. I had my first little trim yesterday to get rid of the fuzz!!    For those in the growing phase, enjoy....for those in the beginnings of hair loss, keep the thought it will come back. It is a long rocky road but you will get there!!    Jean
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jun 7, 2010 04:49PM jeanl151 wrote: charmaine   When my eyebrows were gone I used Laura Geller's eye brow marker.  It stayed on all day and was easy to use.  I bought it on qvc.com   you look great! Jean

Posts.Content: Jun 16, 2010 08:15PM jeanl151 wrote:   ps.....I agree with the bangs concern...I wish they were longer!!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jun 30, 2010 08:40AM jeanl151 wrote:      Luah,  I know what you mean about the problem with going around town without the wig.  With the wig, if you didn't want to tell someone what was going on you didn't have to.      I have only gone 2 weeks without the wig. I have had some different experiences.   If I bump into someone who is not a close friend but someone I have known a long time, they either ask about my health or I mention it.              If it is just someone I am only aquanted with and haven't seen in years, I just smile, say a quick hello and walk away....just keep them guessing!   By doing this I feel like I have some power over my life.  With all these treatments this year I didn't feel any power over anything!!       My hair is about half an inch long and I colored it a couple of weeks ago. I used a root touch up kit because I figured I only have roots. I can see how much has grown in the 2 weeks by how long the grey roots are!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Sep 26, 2009 08:26AM jeanl151 wrote: Thanks for your advice.   Have you been able to continue work thru chemo? How tired are you?  Have the germs from the little children been an issue?
Posts.Title: New to forum jeanl151 Shirlann

Posts.Content: jeanl151 wrote: Hi, my name is Jean. This summer I learned I have triple negative BC. I had a lumpectomy  a few weeks ago and more surgery Wednesday for more lymph nodes and to get clear margins. Now I need to wait for pathology report. If all is clear I will start chemo, if not then probably a mascectomy.   So many questions and worries I have. I am a preschool teacher and worry that it will be too "germy" for me to work through chemo.  Does anyone know how long chemo is with triple negative or is it an individual thing? Dx 7/31/2009, IDC, 1cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 1/12 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: New to forum jeanl151 Shirlann

Posts.Content: Oct 20, 2009 08:02PM jeanl151 wrote: Kcorbin811,  sorry you have to be here, I know this news is unbelievable.  I am glad you found this website. I was diagnosed in July and found the website in Sept.  I have learned so much. My best advise is search through these threads...I found what these women have written are inspiring and informative.. When it came time for me to talk to the doctors, I actually understood what they were talking about. I also had lumpectory and node removal...moving on to chemo. wishing you the best news possible, Jean
